channel.title: Mouse
channel.description:
So I thought this was just a buggy leak of The Sims 3. Sometimes when I'd click to do something, it'd pop up the menu real fast and then disappear. Or if I clicked on an action it'd immediately bring up another menu right under the option.
But now I think it's my mouse or something.
Sometimes when I drag things it opens them right before dragging them. And working in premiere pro animating some masks, it kept jumping into a new layer of just the mask (which is caused by double clicking the mask itself) when I was trying to move.
So basically every now and them (now about 60% of the time) it double clicks instead of single clicking, and it's fucking annoying. It also causes a glitch when I click options in a right click menu, it freezes the option on screen and the menu disappears. So I'll have a little Properties menu option floating around.
So, do you think it's my computer? Or my mouse?
EDIT: Ok it doesn't double click when I drag, but it clicks several times. I found this out making a new mask, I was dragging to make a bezier curve, and every second it placed a new point wherever I was dragging the mouse. Fucking annoying.

item.title: Mouse
item.dc:creator: @united0wnage united0wnage
item.description:
@united0wnage wrote:

It’s your mouse. Mine does the same. it fails during pking. D:

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

The thing about the open/close real fast happens to me too.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I’ll go debo my sisters wireless and see how that one works.

I’m in such an irritated mood right now. This thing has taken so long because every other click fucks it up.

Read full topic

item.title: Mouse
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

almost certainly the mouse. this is how every mouse ive had that died started dying

if youre cheap, open it up and put a bit of a glue or something on the notch (theres like a little notch that pushes the button down when you click, its probably started to wear out from all your nerdraging and has a little hole in it)

yes, i repair £5 mice. low budget

Read full topic
